page.title: 08Peat Cutting in Voe.
page.content: Peat provides many local families with a cheap form of fuel. Firstly the peat bank has to be flaaed.This means you cut away the heather and turf to get to the peat. Then you cast the peats using a tushkar and build the peats into a dyke.The dyke has little gaps in it that the wind blows through to dry the peats. The peats are then raised.This means they are set up in pyramids to dry off completely. Now the peats are ready to be taken home,usually by tractor and trailer. Some people put the peats in bags before loading them onto the trailer. A peat cutting machine is now available to hire at Â£20 per hour. It cuts the peats in cylindrical shapes and speeds up the casting process.
